title: Remove redundant files.
body:
This PR removes redundant files that are no longer needed. These changes help improve the project structure and reduce code size.
Fixes #155
author: NazaninAnsarii

comments.body:
@NazaninAnsarii what @omatheusmesmo mean is you should use fixes, resolves, closes, reference, issue like tags in you PR description / body not in Title which you have done right now. You can check my PR for reference PR #189 .
You can use Screenshot or Little Description about what changes and test case you used or checked / performed after changing the code.

As i see you PR [Remove redundant files. Fixes #155]
Title should contain [Remove redundant files. ]
Body / Description should contain [Fixes #155] Your current PR body is empty.

Thanks.

> @NazaninAnsarii what @omatheusmesmo mean is you should use fixes, resolves, closes, reference, issue like tags in you PR description / body not in Title which you have done right now. You can check my PR for reference PR #189 . You can use Screenshot or Little Description about what changes and test case you used or checked / performed after changing the code.
> 
> As i see you PR [Remove redundant files. Fixes #155] Title should contain [Remove redundant files. ] Body / Description should contain [Fixes #155] Your current PR body is empty.
> 
> Thanks.

Exactly. It's hard close issues so fast as you open PRs! LOL

I created an issue to resolve that too because sometimes I just forget to close the related issues. See #195 for more information.
